learning_objectives.objective: Define key terms including Disaster Recovery (DR) Plan, Recovery Time Objective (RTO), Recovery Point Objective (RPO), and types of DR testing (walkthrough, tabletop, parallel, full interruption).
Explain the role of DR plan testing in enhancing cybersecurity resilience and its relationship to Business Continuity Planning (BCP).
Outline the steps to conduct a tabletop DR test, including preparation, execution, and initial evaluation.
Compare and contrast DR testing methods (e.g., parallel vs. full interruption testing) in terms of disruption level, cost, and validation effectiveness.
Critique a sample DR plan against NIST SP 800-34 criteria, identifying gaps in testing, training, and exercises (TT&E).
Design a customized DR testing exercise for a given organizational scenario, incorporating metrics aligned with RTO/RPO and NIST SP 800-84 guidelines.
